partName: Holden Commodore / Pontiac GTO / Monaro Interchange
notes: The 2004-2006 Pontiac GTO IS a Holden Monaro. Almost all body panels, interior parts, and suspension components interchange with the Holden Commodore VT-VZ series. LS1 and LS2 engine parts are standard GM Gen III/IV architecture.

partName: Holden Commodore VE/VF / Pontiac G8 / Chevy SS
notes: The 'Zeta' platform cars. Pontiac G8 GT/GXP parts are interchangeable with Holden Commodore VE. Chevy SS parts interchange with Holden Commodore VF. You can swap the entire front end (bumper, hood, lights) between G8/VE and SS/VF to 'convert' the look.

The Ford Territory is the 'SUV Falcon'. It uses the same Barra 4.0L I6 engine (N/A and Turbo). The Territory Turbo engine is a cheap source for a Barra swap. Front suspension components (control arms, uprights) are often shared or adaptable.

Older Holdens often swapped differentials. The 'Salisbury' 10-bolt from V8 Commodores or Kingswoods is a common upgrade for the weaker 'Banjo' diffs found in 6-cylinder Toranas and early Commodores. Requires checking width and mounting points.
Australian Fords often used the legendary 9-inch rear end. These are highly sought after for drag racing builds worldwide. The housing width varies, but the center section (pumpkin) is universal.
